channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target Time and superquiz, Wednesday, December 16

item.dc:creator: Katrina Lobley
item.description: Perhaps its time to turn off onto roads less travelled on that summer road trip.
item.title: The upgraded Pacific Highway: faster, safer, but oh-so-much duller

item.description: Councils have been stealing land off golfers for years. It does not matter that the land would never be there except for the efforts of golf clubs in the past
item.title: Of course, close golf clubs: developers might chip in

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: SANZAAR boss Andy Marinos is the frontrunner for the top job at Rugby Australia.
item.title: Marinos tipped to land rugby CEO's position

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: The Wests Tigers recruit anticipated rival clubs picking apart former club Penrith, but was stunned by Brent Naden's cocaine news.
item.title: 'The poor guy had demons': Tamou feels for mate Naden after drug shock

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: A migration from cities to suburban and regional areas during the COVID-19 pandemic has led to widespread office vacancies, greater strain on the broadband network, greater energy and water consumption in residential areas and increased local traffic congestion.
item.title: COVID-19 city exodus puts strain on local broadband, power and traffic networks

item.description: I’d suggest that Samuel Beckett’s masterpiece Waiting for Godot may now be essential Christmas reading for those locked out of essential mental health services.
item.title: No, this is not an episode of Yes Minister, it's the Morrison government's response to the mental health crisis

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: A group of 33 academics have called for greater investment in community services that have been stretched during the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: 'Shadow pandemics' exposed under-resourced community services

item.dc:creator: Nigel Gladstone
item.description: Senior police are wasting vast amounts of time investigating petty internal complaints to hassle good cops out the door, dozens of NSW police say.
item.title: Toxic force: police claim bosses use complaints to target them

item.dc:creator: Adele Ferguson
item.description: It has taken three years but justice is finally on the cards for franchise owners burnt by Retail Food Group, a company that built its business on human misery.
item.title: Retail Food Group needs to right the wrongs of the past

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Waterbird populations across eastern Australia have failed to respond to drought-breaking rains as large dams grabbed the bulk of flows, the latest annual survey has found.
item.title: Drought-breaking rains not enough to boost wetland bird numbers

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: Service NSW revealed in September that 186,000 people were affected by a data breach. The true figure is 80,000 less - and about 25,000 people were wrongfully warned their data had been compromised.
item.title: Service NSW data breach affected 80,000 fewer people than first thought

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: The main legacy of my school banking enrolment was the fact that I still had a Commonwealth Bank account years later. That, I now realise, was the point.
item.title: Why school banking has had its day

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Qantas-owned Jetstar is fortifying its local fleet to to fill the gap in the market left by the Virgin’s closure of its budget brand Tigerair.
item.title: Jetstar to boost flights above pre-COVID levels by March

item.description: The NSW government would have little to lose and much to gain from evaluating its new scheme.
item.title: Next step in school tutoring blitz is critical for success

item.description: From assembling trampolines to installing lights and wrapping gifts, a whole array of Christmas odd jobs are being outsourced this year.
item.title: Christmas to-do list piling up? There's help for that – for a price

item.dc:creator: Harry Hollinsworth
item.description: English film star John Mills arrived in Sydney last night to play the leading part of Barney in the film Summer of the Seventeenth Doll.
item.title: In the Herald: December 16, 1958

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Wednesday, December 16

item.description: Featuring the talents of "demon bowlers" Fernie Blade and Grace Marks, the week-long Country Week carnival was a showcase for women's cricket in New South Wales.
item.title: From the Archives, 1932: Women cricketers' City vs Country carnival

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Some of our political leaders have readily accepted a piece of aviation history.
item.title: Trolley dolly life for Albanese with gift from Qantas

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, December 16, 2020

item.dc:creator: Shaun Carney
item.description: Some of us hoped that this might be the beginning of a new era of political co-operation and consensus.
item.title: Federal IR bill just tinkering around the edges

item.description: Now we are feeling safer going to the doctor, there are a lot of appointments to catch up on.
item.title: Testing times ahead, even after lockdown

item.description: Limiting religious freedom to prevent harm isn’t new and we shouldn’t be afraid of it.
item.title: Churches' fears for conversion bill are unfounded

item.description: The finding of an old diary offered a view to long ago friendships and lost loves.
item.title: A visit to my parents offers a glimpse into the past

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: A surge in home-delivered food and online shopping during COVID-19 lockdowns has generated an alarming 20 per cent increase in household rubbish.
item.title: Australians urged to ditch rubbish habits picked up in lockdown

item.dc:creator: Garry Maddox
item.description: After helping his daughter get through year 12 during lockdown, the Australian actor stars in the film version of Jane Harper's bestseller.
item.title: Eric Bana feels no pressure as The Dry chases Wonder Woman into cinemas

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: A court claim lifts the lid on a bitter dispute at the highest level of the sport, with former director Cheryl McCormack accusing the national governing body of breaching anti-discrimination and corporations laws.
item.title: Federal Court to umpire Netball Australia stoush

item.dc:creator: Noel Whittaker
item.description: Financial guru Noel Whittaker shares some of his top investment and personal finance tips to help set you on the right path to financial freedom.
item.title: Whittaker's financial 'commandments': Easy rules to help you get ahead

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: An extra 10,000 home care packages, at a cost of $850 million, will be funded by the federal government as it expands its response to the Aged Care Royal Commission.
item.title: Extra $1 billion for aged care but budget still faces record debt and deficit

item.description: Energy bills are up between 10 per cent and 30 per cent this year and they are not going to pay themselves.
item.title: Bad debt 'time bomb' ready to explode

item.description: Takahiro Shiraishi was found guilty of killing, dismembering and storing the bodies of the victims in his apartment.
item.title: Japan's 'Twitter killer' sentenced to death for serial murders

item.dc:creator: Felicity Caldwell
item.description: People detained at the medium-security facility have been charged with criminal offences but found unfit to stand trial.
item.title: Christmas lights bus tour for patients declared unfit to stand trial

item.description: Christmas can be expensive. Here's our list of simple steps to take to help minimise the cost.
item.title: Christmas spending doesn't have to blow your household budget

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: Farms are allowed to employ pickers on piecework wages, which reward those who pick quickly but can result in some legally earning less than minimum wage.
item.title: Union applies to change pay rules for fruit pickers to ensure minimum wage

item.description: A single form is now required to appoint a nominee to able to act on a person's behalf for both Centrelink payment and aged-care costs.
item.title: Single form system refinement is long overdue

item.dc:creator: Noel Whittaker
item.description: All assets owned by yourself or your partner are assessable and you should receive 50 per cent of what a pensioner couple would normally receive.
item.title: Retiring? What happens with your pension when your spouse is working

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: The way we live and work is set to change next year. Australia's superannuation system will also see major change.
item.title: Take note: Your super will radically change in 2021

item.description: The hide of some cheque writers!
item.title: A valedictory for one, more cowbell for some

item.dc:creator: Esther Han
item.description: Tens of thousands of people in northern NSW, from the Hunter up to the Northern Rivers region, have been urged to remain alert for thunderstorms that could dump heavy rain and cause flash flooding.
item.title: 'Evolving flood situation': Safety warnings as rain continues this week

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Two of Australia's emerging NBA guards impressed on Tuesday as Dante Exum led the Cavs to their second pre-season win and rookie guard Josh Green shone for the Dallas Mavericks.
item.title: Exum firms as Cavs back-up point guard while Green lets his game do the talking

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The Palaszczuk government previously promised the project would be "operational" by 2024.
item.title: No commuters will ride Cross River Rail trains until mid 2025

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: The Supreme Court of Israel has found that the former Melbourne principal can be extradited to Australia to face charges of sex abuse.
item.title: Israel Supreme Court clears ways for accused paedophile Malka Leifer's extradition

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: A Wilcannia teacher has won recognition for her use of music to increase attendance at the school. It culminated during lockdown, but it started two years ago.
item.title: Don't give up on me, the informal anthem of Wilcannia's students

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: A state government document has revealed the Health Department provided confusing information to families and workers, leading to people breaching isolation orders.
item.title: DHHS dropped the ball on Colac COVID outbreaks, says leaked report

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Former Diamond Sharni Layton took to social media on Tuesday to question whether the cap should be raised following news the Fever had overspent in 2018 and 2019.
item.title: Netball salary cap questioned after West Coast Fever breach
